tweets.text: Today two @EnvAgency field operations officers from our Cramlington depot cleared parts of the River Don at West Boldon in preparation for the forecast bad weather by #StormAlex and to their surprise they fished out 18 shopping trolleys which were returned to @asda #Boldon https://t.co/WxRtfZv2QY

1st storm of the season #StormAlex is here. EA & MetOffice are forecasting medium-high flood risk across the England & Wales, higher risk of flooding in Devon & Cornwall and coastal flooding likely in the SW & SE. Links & info below for farmers from @EnvAgency & @CLAtweets

tweets.text:
We're expecting some stormy weather & heavy rain across parts of the #Midlands this weekend. Make sure you stay #FloodAware

➡️Check your #flood risk: https://t.co/Yu9SYkYtrI
➡️Sign up for flood alerts:
https://t.co/4G9UCfW5wr 
➡️Call Floodline: 0345 988 1188
 
#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/J4jrKA9AB6

More stormy and persistent rain is expected this weekend across parts of England.

Stay safe and sign up for flood alerts: https://t.co/P5d6Ax7xwQ

 #Floods #Flooding https://t.co/3YfkRdZjwe

As Area Duty Manager, the incident duty team are busy monitoring and planning for Storm Alex. We have extra field staff on the ground checking assets and clearing trash screens etc. @EnvAgencySW https://t.co/hKQHEWm5QE

Join us on the 4th December to discuss #Flood and #CoastalErosion risk management? Speakers include @EmmaHowardBoyd @EnvAgency @floodre @simonpic78 @InnesThomson @NatFloodForum @fayflood @AECOM @DrFox_Tim & @unitedutilities
Click here to find out more: https://t.co/Msdd1q2YRA https://t.co/oLHNU00BIi

The Environment Agency’s annual report on #WaterCompanies' environmental performance shows much more needs to be done to protect our #WaterQuality

Read more on the blog, including @EmmaHowardBoyd's statement on what action needs to be taken 👇

https://t.co/fkwItn2LQb
@EnvAgency

tweets.text: The @EnvAgency's report into the environmental performance of water companies is released today. You can read the press release, my foreword and the full report here:  https://t.co/mwr4EUcpjm

Another day another @EnvAgency failure.

Four out of nine water companies in England are now rated as poor when it comes to pollution, the worst result since 2011.

For how much longer I wonder will @MPGeorgeEustice tolerate the incompetence?

https://t.co/X05iHf0Lxu

Enforcement patrols out yesterday engaging with River users  in the #Cleeve Reach a total of 138 vessels checked ,46 booked unregistered and 16 No name issued .#TeamEA @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @wifo_ea @TobyWillisonEA

tweets.text:
With wet weather 🌧️ approaching this weekend, our Field Teams have been busy maintaining our assets & removing debris from culverts to avoid potential blockages & reduce #flood risk like here in #Haydock

 Check your risk at  👉https://t.co/ZAITy41Ta6 https://t.co/dYKdnfv7YB

urls.title: Find out if you're at risk of flooding in England
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, check the 5-day forecast or use flood maps

tweets.text: @EnvAgencySE Will be contacting- AVDC in Bucks raised the road by resurfacing but not the pavements adjoins properties. Residents are having their homes flooded with rainwater and sewage. #AVDC have said since June they are too busy to deal with it!

One of the frequent ways we prevent flooding ahead of storms is make sure rivers are clear of blockages and flowing nicely...

Like here today in #Surrey ⬇️... but not just Surrey; our teams are doing this work across the country #floodaware #StormAlex https://t.co/KSPvb62m6V

With water pollution incidents rising, and not a single river, lake or stream meeting good chemical status according to recent @EnvAgency data, it's time to seriously increase investment in restoring the health of our blue environments. h/t @hannahsrudd https://t.co/dH4bWqKsLG

tweets.text:
We’ve been notified by @LRT of cases of #MittenCrabs in the #Lune estuary. Mitten Crabs can harm river embankments & native species. 

Please remember to check, clean & dry to reduce the spread of invasive species.

To report sightings & for more info: https://t.co/3PnEARbPp0 https://t.co/pfYAdVdo1p

Our field teams are working hard checking flood defences and clearing screens in preparation for heavy rain and high winds this weekend that could cause localised flooding. Be prepared. Check https://t.co/G0SjP0XBX4 or call Floodline on 0345 988 1188 for the latest flood updates.

tweets.text:
Was a great moment to watch this yesterday - moments where the progress is obvious are always a highlight of working on projects like this! 
@The_RRC @Trent_R_Trust @EnvAgencyMids #conservationist #riverrestoration #staffsSUNRISE https://t.co/QVQ3sfgZoa

With the forecast of widespread & persistent heavy rain across the #Midlands this weekend we're getting ready for a risk of #flood, but are you?

Check your flood risk, sign up for free flood warnings & keep up to date at https://t.co/Yu9SYkYtrI or call Floodline on 0345 988 1188 https://t.co/zi1MDrZbJQ

Water quality in England has generally improved, but there’s still much to do.

@JamesBevanEA sets out the facts on:

👍 what has improved
⚠ what needs to get better
➡️ what are we doing to improve things?

Read it here: https://t.co/EwoqTKFeUE
#WaterQuality #WaterCompanies

Just because you are outside of Northamptonshire it doesn't mean you can get away with flytipping. 
The @EnvAgency have all sorts of methods at their disposal. It's time to #ScrapFlytipping https://t.co/P97xy80ktH
@MariaHerlihyEA @EnvAgencySE @MarkHill03 @wifo_ea @sarahchareEA @TobyWillisonEA All the feedback from passing Farnham residents was positive whilst carrying out this removal.
Field teams today removing a tree from the watercourse  at #Hatch Mill today.#TeamEA .⁦@EnvAgencySE⁩ ⁦@MarkHill03⁩ ⁦@wifo_ea⁩ ⁦@sarahchareEA⁩ ⁦@TobyWillisonEA⁩ https://t.co/hrQsvPKGsa

New figures show #water company #pollution incidents rose from 1,863 in 2018 to 2,204 in 2019. 

Anglian, Southern, South West & Northumbrian Water all rated poor by @EnvAgency, putting the #25YearEnvironmentPlan & ecological recovery at risk.

https://t.co/WCsN6fStKk https://t.co/bHhT3FoqXm

Sadly #flood #forecast for the weekend has worsened. Low likelihood of significant impacts from surface water & river. @EnvAgencyNW prep work continues. #BePrepared #floodaware #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/YYPj5C5R15

tweets.text: The government must intervene - water companies are not being held to account for their unique role and have been allowed to pollute with impunity by @EnvAgency. @MPGeorgeEustice @pow_rebecca must take the responsibility the @EnvAgency has foregone https://t.co/Xn0o4O705d

tweets.text: ⚡BREAKING⚡ I wanted to create something that @Tampax couldn't ignore, so say hello to the Giant Tampax Applicator! It is 6ft tall and is made exclusively from 1,200 Tampax applicators collected from beaches and waterways across the UK. #EndPeriodPlastic https://t.co/55XyIsTLTR https://t.co/VTfU8biUWf

Flood risk across the country this weekend. You can check flood warnings for free here (updated every 15 minutes). https://t.co/CnoJPZIDpY If you don't know what @EnvAgency's flood warnings mean, see ⬇️ https://t.co/u6wZHLZJ9t

High winds and heavy rain could cause surface water and river flooding over the weekend. Do not try to drive through floodwater. Be prepared. For the latest updates see
https://t.co/G0SjP0XBX4, or call Floodline on 0345 988 1188.

Listen to my interview with @AmosAnnabel on @BBCNorthampton this morning RE the traveller encampment at Pineham Locks. 

The clean up operation now begins. I'll be working closely with Cllr @pinder_chauhan, @NorthamptonBC & @EnvAgency to ensure rubbish is cleared from the site.👍 https://t.co/vWbn4lLZKZ

Just 6 months after admitting to 8,400 pollution incidents in court @SouthernWater still manage to top the 2019 polluter in chief scoreboard.

What's clear is the @EnvAgency has no control over this company and even clearer, it is now time for @Ofwat to revoke SW's licence. https://t.co/1KqXjd6XYE

As a little contrast everyday water companies leak 2,954,000,000 litres of water from their underinvested, under repaired, faulty, leaky pipes.

Yep that's 1,078,210,000,000 litres of water per year stolen from our rivers.

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/RkJP0KAsoX
